parts.body:
The $` 65 `
form a sample because not all
$` {27 + 45 + 18 = 90} `
members replied, so the $` 65 `
is a subset of the population $` \QED  `

Choosing a random sample means
all members have a equal chance of being
chosen so this leads to a sample that is free
from bias $` \QED  `

There are 3 cases to consider: - 3 Adult members, 2 Youth members and 1 Senior member - 3 Adult members, 1 Youth member and 2 Senior members - 4 Adult members, 1 Youth member and 1 Senior member Only in the first case the committee contains more Youth members than Senior members ``` =html
P(required)=(453)(272)(181)(453)(272)(181)+(453)(271)(182)+(454)(271)(181)=1332âˆŽ
``` ``` =tex \begin{align*} &\mathrm{P} \left( \text{required} \right) \\ &= \frac{{ 45 \choose 3 }{ 27 \choose 2 }{ 18 \choose 1 }}{{ 45 \choose 3 }{ 27 \choose 2 }{ 18 \choose 1 } + { 45 \choose 3 }{ 27 \choose 1 }{ 18 \choose 2 } + { 45 \choose 4 }{ 27 \choose 1 }{ 18 \choose 1 }} \\ &= \frac{13}{32} \; \QED \end{align*} ```

It comprise a sample as the $` 65 `
members is a subset of the population.

Choosing a random sample means all members
have a equal chance of being chosen so this
leads to a sample that is free from bias.
